DOCNAME: CASE OF STEFF v. THE UNITED KINGDOM
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s wife died on DATE , leaving CARDINAL children , born in DATE and DATE . On DATE the applicant applied for widow ’s benefits . By a letter dated DATE , ORG informed him that it was unable to pay him any of the benefits claimed because he was not a woman .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied for an allowance under the Income and Corporation Taxes Act DATE on the same basis as he would receive it if he were a widow whose husband died in similar circumstances . He only received a letter of reply on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant did not appeal further as he considered or was advised that such a remedy would be bound to fail since no social security or tax benefits were payable to widowers under GPE law .

CARDINAL . The domestic law relevant to this application is set out in PERSON v. the GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-IV and PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and Geen v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL , GPE , GPE and GPE , DATE .
